plot: Mix-and-Match: Scalable Dialog Response Retrieval using Gaussian Mixture Embeddings
summary: Embedding-based approaches for dialog response retrieval embed the context-response pairs as points in the embedding space. These approaches are scalable, but fail to account for complex relationships that exist between context and response pairs. In this paper, they combine the best of both worlds by proposing a scalable model that can learn complex relationships. They train the models by optimizing the Kullback-Leibler divergence between the distributions induced by context and responses in training data. They show that the resultant model achieves better performance as compared to other embedding-based approach on publicly available conversation data.
